Hero.title: The way to get your driving license
Hero.description: Keep track of your every step and progress, as well as book appointments and send messages, all in one place.

DriverData.title: All the information in one place
DriverData.description: Access all the information you need. Keep track of your progress, appointments, and messages in one central location.

DriverData.title: Visualized process guide
DriverData.description: See exactly which steps you have already completed and what's next, from the first aid course to the theory and driving lessons and the final exam.

DriverData.title: Intuitive and modern design
DriverData.description: The intuitive design, combined with a visually modern layout, ensures that you can easily track your learning progress and quickly find the information you need.

DriverData.title: Flexible appointment booking
DriverData.description: Whether it’s a consultation, theory lesson, or driving lesson—book your appointments directly online with your driving school. No more time-consuming calls or waiting.

DriverData.title: Direct communication
DriverData.description: Use the integrated chat function to quickly and easily ask your driving school questions. Your driving school will also communicate with you about things like exam dates.

DriverData.title: Reminders and notifications
DriverData.description: Receive automatic reminders for upcoming appointments, theory and driving lessons, or exams.

DriverData.title: Available in two languages
DriverData.description: You can choose between German and English. All service functions are available in both languages.

SchoolsData.title: Efficient appointment management
SchoolsData.description: Manage all theory courses and driving lessons in one place and reduce administrative work—less paperwork, more clarity.

SchoolsData.title: Simple communication
SchoolsData.description: Send messages to individual students or entire groups to inform them about appointments, changes, or news—quick and direct.

SchoolsData.title: Reduced administrative effort
SchoolsData.description: Cut down on calls and emails: students book appointments themselves, and all necessary information is shared through the integrated chat function.

SchoolsData.title: Better resource planning
SchoolsData.description: Plan your vehicles and instructors efficiently. The online booking system helps optimize utilization with clear calendars and automated scheduling.

SchoolsData.title: Student progress at a glance
SchoolsData.description: Track each student’s learning status digitally. This allows you to create personalized learning plans and adjust lessons more effectively.

SchoolsData.title: Digital student records
SchoolsData.description: All important information and bookings per student stored in one place. All communication is securely stored and GDPR compliant.

SchoolsData.title: Professional appearance
SchoolsData.description: Offer your students a modern and intuitive platform—a big plus with younger audiences. It strengthens trust in your school and sets you apart from competitors.

Pricing.title: Our prices for driving students and schools

FaqData.title: What is WieFührerschein?
FaqData.content: WieFührerschein is a service that connects driving students and driving schools on a central platform. Students can track their learning progress, book appointments, and communicate with their driving school. Driving schools use our platform to manage their students, coordinate appointments, and optimize their communication.

FaqData.title: What do I need to apply for a driver's license?
FaqData.content:
To apply for a driver's license, you will generally need the following documents:
• Identity card or passport
• Biometric passport photo
• Eye test certificate (not older than two years)
• Proof of participation in a first aid course
• If applicable, registration confirmation from your driving school

FaqData.title: Where do I have to go to apply for my driving license?
FaqData.content: You submit the application to the driver's license authority responsible for your place of residence. When you enter your place of residence, we will show you which authority is responsible for you. Your driving school can often also assist you with this step.

FaqData.title: What driving license classes are there?
FaqData.content:
There are six driving license classes: A, B, C, D, L, and T. The most common car licenses are classes B and BF17.
• Class B: Allows you to drive motor vehicles up to 3.5 tons total weight. The minimum age is 18 years.
• Class BF17: This is 'accompanied driving from the age of 17'. The same conditions as class B apply, but you may only drive when accompanied by a registered person.
On our website, under the Driving License Classes section, you can see all classes and their differences.

FaqData.title: How many theory lessons do you have to take?
FaqData.content: The number of theory lessons depends on the driver's license class. For classes A and B, 12 double lessons of basic theory and two double lessons of class-specific instruction are required. If you extend your license (e.g., if you already have a driver's license), the total number of lessons is reduced to 8. The total number of lessons for class C is 18, and for class D, 20.

FaqData.title: How many driving lessons do you have to take?
FaqData.content:
There is no minimum number of regular practice lessons – it depends on your learning progress, and your instructor decides when you are ready for the test. In addition, the following special driving lessons are legally required:
• Class A: 12 special driving lessons
• Class B: 12 special driving lessons
• Class C: 10 special driving lessons
• Class D: 10 special driving lessons

FaqData.title: How do I get my driver's license after the test?
FaqData.content: After passing the practical test, you will either receive your license directly from the examiner or a few days later by mail or collection at the driving license authority – depending on the region.

FaqData.title: When does my driver's license need to be exchanged?
FaqData.content: All driving licenses issued before January 19, 2013, must be gradually exchanged for the new EU card-based driving license. The deadlines are staggered according to your year of birth or the date the driving license was issued. As a general rule, the new driving license must be renewed every 15 years, although the driving license itself remains valid for an unlimited period.

FaqData.title: How do you convert a driver's license?
FaqData.content: A foreign driver's license is only valid in Germany for a limited time (usually 6 months after taking up residence). Depending on the country where your license was issued, a theoretical and/or practical test may be required. There are exceptions if there is an agreement on mutual recognition between Germany and the issuing country. To convert your license, you must apply for conversion at the responsible driver's license authority in your place of residence. We will guide you step by step through this process when you register on our website.

LicenseSteps.title: Steps For All Driving License Classes
LicenseSteps.dataA: Motorcycles in four categories, from light mopeds to larger motorcycles.
LicenseSteps.dataB: Passenger cars and light commercial vehicles, excluding motorcycles.
LicenseSteps.dataC: Trucks and motor vehicles with a maximum permissible mass of more than 3,500 kg.
LicenseSteps.dataD: Buses and motor vehicles used to transport more than 8 people.
LicenseSteps.dataL: L stands for agricultural and T for tractor. These classes apply to tractors.
LicenseSteps.dataRewrite: Anyone who moves permanently to Germany from third countries must have their foreign driving license converted.

Services.title: Start now. It's free!
Services.des: Find out for yourself how our service works

steps.title: Driving License Class
steps.heading: Select your driving license class
steps.description: Which driving license do you need? Select the appropriate category. We'll guide you step by step through the process of obtaining your driver's license.

steps.title: Place of Residence
steps.heading: Enter where you live
steps.description: Either the driving license authority or the TÜV, when you enter your place of residence, the authorities and their contact addresses that correspond to you will be displayed in your account.

steps.title: Driving School
steps.heading: Find your driving school
steps.description: By connecting your driving school, you can book appointments and send messages. Your driving school can also track and modify your progress.

steps.title: Process Guide
steps.heading: Follow the path to your driver's license
steps.description: We visualize your path to obtaining your driver's license step by step and provide an overview of exactly what is required and when.

steps.title: Register
steps.heading: Register your driving school
steps.description: Create a user account and register your driving school for free on our website. You'll need a valid email address and a secure password.

steps.title: Information
steps.heading: Enter information about your driving school
steps.description: Information such as name, contact address, opening hours, etc. helps learner drivers communicate with you.

steps.title: Process
steps.heading: Enter the order of the process
steps.description: The order of steps for obtaining a driver's license may vary at some driving schools. Enter yours.

steps.title: Driving licence authority
steps.heading: Identify the responsible authorities
steps.description: Select from the list which driving license authority and TÜV your students should go to.

steps.title: Website
steps.heading: Open our website in Safari
steps.description: First, navigate to our website in Safari. If no popup appears to install our website, follow the next steps.

steps.title: Share icon
steps.heading: Tap  the share icon
steps.description: Tap the share icon (a square with an up arrow) in the bottom center. This opens the sharing menu options.

steps.title: Home screen
steps.heading: Select “Add to Home Screen”
steps.description: Select the "Add to Home Screen" option from the menu. This adds the web app to the list of available apps.

steps.title: Name
steps.heading: Set the name and confirm it
steps.description: Give the app a name if necessary and confirm the process by tapping "Add." The website will now appear like an app on your home screen.

steps.title: Website
steps.heading: Open our website in Chrome
steps.description: First, navigate to the website in Chrome. If you didn't see a popup asking you to install our website, follow the next steps.

steps.title: Three-dot icon
steps.heading: Tap on the three-dot icon
steps.description: Tap the three-dot menu (⋮) in the top or bottom right corner of the browser. This will open Chrome's main menu.

steps.title: Home screen
steps.heading: Select “Add to Home Screen”
steps.description: Choose the option "Add to Home Screen" from the menu. Sometimes this option is shown as "Install App."

steps.title: Name
steps.heading: Set the name and confirm it
steps.description: Give the app a name of your choice and tap "Add." The PWA icon will now appear on your home screen.

Footer.description: We connect learner drivers and driving schools through a digital service.

loginPage.heading: Welcome back!
loginPage.passMin: Password must be at least 8 characters long
loginPage.passChar: Password must contain at least one number

registerPage.heading: Create an account as:
registerPage.passMin: Password must be at least 8 characters long
registerPage.passChar: Password must contain at least one number
registerPage.lastpoint: We offer our service exclusively for driving license classes A and B as well as the conversion of foreign driving licenses of these classes into German ones.

passwordPage.heading: Forgot Password?
passwordPage.description: Please enter your email address to continue. We will send you instructions to reset your password.

licenseA.fileTitle:
ID - passport photo - eye test - first aid
If applicable, driver's license copy
licenseA.heading3: Step-by-step guide to a class A driving license
licenseA.descriptionhero: Motorcycles in four categories, from light mopeds to larger  motorcycles.
licenseA.description: We only offer our service to the driving classes of A and B, as well as Rewrite (conversion of foreign driving licenses of these classes to German ones). Due to small number of driving schools supporting the driving classes of C, D, L, and T, it is not feasible for us to support these classes at the moment. We hope that we can support these classes as well in the future.

stepsData.title: Driving school registration
content: Choose a certified driving school.
Sign training contract with driving school.

stepsData.title: Prepare documents
content: Identity card or passport: proof of residence.
Biometric passport photo: standard format.
Eye test: Must not be older than 2 years.
First aid course: 9 teaching units.

stepsData.title: Driving license application
content: The application for a driving license must be submitted to your responsible driving license office.
The application is submitted either through your driving school or directly to the office.

stepsData.title: Theory lessons
content: Raw material: 12 double lessons.
Additive material: 2 to 4 double lessons.

stepsData.title: Theoretical exam
content: Earliest 3 months before minimum age.
Approx. 30 questions in multiple-choice format.
Max. 10 penalty points allowed.
Approved by TÜV or DEKRA.

stepsData.title: Driving lessons
content: Overland: 5 trips.
Highway: 4 trips.
Night: 3 trips.
In addition, there are normal practice runs.

stepsData.title: Practical exam
content: Earliest 1 month before minimum age.
Approx. 45 to 60 minutes.
Vehicle check, driving behavior in city, country and motorway traffic, reversing, parking, hazard assessment.
Failed: Retake only possible after 2 weeks.

stepsData.title: Issuing a driving license
content: The EU driving license is issued.
Get your driving license from the driver’s license office.
For BF17: Driving test certificate only, driving allowed only with registered accompanying persons.

drivingRules.title: Gradual ascent
drivingRules.description: Anyone who has held a class A2 driving license (medium-weight motorcycles) for two years can upgrade directly to class A with a practical exam, without having to take another theory exam.

drivingRules.title: Vehicle restrictions
drivingRules.description: Class A entitles you to drive all motorcycles, regardless of engine capacity or power.

drivingRules.title: Practical exam
drivingRules.description: The practical exam lasts at least 60 minutes and includes both driving in traffic and the demonstration of basic driving tasks (e.g. slalom, braking, evasive maneuvers).

drivingRules.title: AM and mopeds
drivingRules.description: The additional materials for class AM are limited to 2 double lessons. No practical exam is required for mopeds.

drivingRules.title: Rewrite
drivingRules.description: Anyone holding an old Class 3 driving license (pre-1999) automatically has the restricted Class AM and A1 (valid only in Germany). For the unrestricted Class A, a conversion and, if necessary, an exam is required. The old Class 3 driving license must be exchanged for a new EU driving license by 2033 at the latest.

drivingCosts.title: Basic driving school fee
drivingCosts.cost: 500–1.000 € (depending on the region and driving school)

drivingCosts.title: Driving lessons
drivingCosts.cost: 600–1.200 € (depending on the number of hours required)

drivingCosts.title: Total costs
drivingCosts.cost: 1.500–3.000 € (depending on individual learning time and region)

drivingRules.title: Accompanied driving from 17 (BF17)
drivingRules.description: At 17, you are allowed to drive with an accompanying adult (at least 30 years old, at least five years of continuous possession of a Class B license, and a maximum of one point in Flensburg). The exam certificate is only valid in Germany.

drivingRules.title: Trailer regulation
drivingRules.description: With class B, you can tow trailers up to 750 kg. For heavier trailers, class BE or B96 is required.

drivingRules.title: Automatic regulation (B197)
drivingRules.description: Training partly on automatic, but driving a manual car is still permitted if at least 10 hours training on a manual plus a 15-minute exam on a manual have been completed.

drivingRules.title: Automatic restriction
drivingRules.description: Those who take the exam in an automatic transmission will receive a driving license with the key number 78 (automatic transmission only). An additional test is required for manual transmissions.

drivingRules.title: Rewrite
drivingRules.description: Holders of an old Class 3 driving license (before 1999) automatically have Class B. A conversion is only necessary for the new EU card driving license, not for the driving license itself.

drivingCosts.title: Basic driving school fee
drivingCosts.cost: 300–800 € (depending on the region and driving school)

drivingCosts.title: Driving lessons
drivingCosts.cost: 1.200–2.000 € (depending on the number of hours required)

drivingCosts.title: Total costs
drivingCosts.cost: 2.000–4.000 € (depending on individual learning time and region)

licenseC.descriptionhero: Trucks and motor vehicles with a maximum permissible mass of more than 3,500 kg.

stepsData.title: Driving school registration
content: Choose a certified driving school.
Sign training contract with driving school.

stepsData.title: Prepare documents
content: Identity card or passport: proof of residence.
Biometric passport photo: standard format.
Ophthalmological certificate: acuity, visual field, color vision, etc.
First aid course: 9 teaching units.
Medical examination (form: §11 FeV): family doctor or company doctor.
Copy of driving license: Class B.

stepsData.title: Driving license application
content: The application for a driving license must be submitted to your responsible driving license office.
The application is submitted either through your driving school or directly to the office.

stepsData.title: Theory lessons
content: Raw material: 6 double lessons.
Additive material: 4 to 10 double lessons.

stepsData.title: Theoretical exam
content: At earliest 3 months before minimum age.
Approx. 30-40 questions in multiple-choice format.
Max. 10 penalty points allowed.
Approved by TÜV or DEKRA.

stepsData.title: Driving lessons
content: Overland: 5 trips.
Highway: 2 trips.
Night: 3 trips.
In addition, there are normal practice runs.

stepsData.title: Practical exam
content: At earliest 1 month before minimum age.
Approx. 75 minutes.
Vehicle check, driving behavior in city, country and motorway traffic, reversing, parking, hazard assessment.
Failed: Retake only possible after 2 weeks.

stepsData.title: Issuing a driving license
content: The EU driving license is issued.
Get your driving license from the driver’s license office.
Validity: 5 years, then another medical and ophthalmological examination is required for extension.

drivingRules.title: Strict requirements
drivingRules.description: A medical and ophthalmological examination is required. An ophthalmological report is required according to the German Federal Regulations on Ophthalmology (FeV), which is more stringent than for Class B.

drivingRules.title: Professional driver qualification (BKrFQG)
drivingRules.description: Anyone who wants to drive commercially also needs a basic qualification (IHK examination) and regular further training (every 5 years).

drivingRules.title: Accelerated initial qualification
drivingRules.description: It is possible to complete the basic qualification in 140 hours (instead of 280 hours) if you choose accelerated training.

drivingRules.title: Joint acquisition of C-CE or C1-C1E
drivingRules.description: If intended to get both licenses together, the number of additives materials and special trips increases.

drivingRules.title: Rewrite
drivingRules.description: Holders of an old Class 2 driving license (before 1999) automatically have Class C. A conversion is only necessary for the new EU card driving license, not for the driving license itself.

drivingCosts.title: Basic driving school fee
drivingCosts.cost: 1.000–2.000 € (depending on the region and driving school)

drivingCosts.title: Driving lessons
drivingCosts.cost: 2.000–4.000 € (depending on the number of hours required)

drivingCosts.title: Total costs
drivingCosts.cost: 5.000–10.000 € (depending on individual learning time and region)

Due to small number of driving schools supporting the driving classes of C, D, L, and T, it is not feasible for us to support these classes at the moment. We hope that we can support these classes as well in the future.

drivingRules.title: Strict requirements
drivingRules.description: A medical and ophthalmological examination is required. An ophthalmological report is required according to the German Federal Regulations on Ophthalmology (FeV), which is more stringent than for Class B.

drivingRules.title: Professional driver qualification (BKrFQG)
drivingRules.description: Anyone who wants to drive commercially also needs a basic qualification (IHK examination) and regular further training (every 5 years).

drivingRules.title: Accelerated initial qualification
drivingRules.description: It is possible to complete the basic qualification in 140 hours (instead of 280 hours) if you choose accelerated training.

drivingRules.title: Passenger transport
drivingRules.description: Class D entitles you to commercial and non-commercial passenger transport (e.g. regular buses, coaches, school buses).

drivingRules.title: Rewrite
drivingRules.description: Holders of an old Class 2 driving license (before 1999) automatically have Class C. A conversion is only necessary for the new EU card driving license, not for the driving license itself.

drivingRules.title: Area of application
drivingRules.description: Both classes are particularly relevant for agricultural and forestry businesses, municipalities and horticulture.

drivingRules.title: Class L
drivingRules.description: Authorized to drive tractors up to 40 km/h and self-propelled machines (e.g. combine harvesters) up to 25 km/h.

drivingRules.title: Class T
drivingRules.description: Authorized to drive tractors up to 60 km/h (also with trailer) and self-propelled work machines up to 40 km/h.

drivingRules.title: Requirement
drivingRules.description: If you hold a different driving license class, the basic material is reduced to six two-hour lessons.

drivingRules.title: Rewrite
drivingRules.description: Holders of an old Class 3 driving license (before 1999) automatically have Class L. A conversion is only necessary for the new EU card driving license, not for the driving license itself.

Old driving license and its translation.

stepsData.title: Driving license application
content: The application for a driving license must be submitted to your responsible driving license office.
The application is submitted either through your driving school or directly to the office.

stepsData.title: Theory lessons
content: Usually not required.
Optional: depending on the driving school.

stepsData.title: Theoretical exam
content: At earliest 3 months before minimum age.
Approx. 30 questions in multiple-choice format.
Max. 10 penalty points allowed.
Approved by TÜV or DEKRA.

stepsData.title: Driving lessons
content: No prescribed number of driving lessons.
The number of driving lessons varies from individual to individual.

stepsData.title: Practical exam
content: No practical exam for class L.
Approx. 45 to 60 minutes.
Vehicle check, driving behavior in city, country and motorway traffic, reversing, parking, hazard assessment.
Failed: Retake only possible after 2 weeks.

stepsData.title: Issuing a driving license
content: The driving license is issued.
Get your driving license from the driver’s license office.

drivingRules.title: Deadlines
drivingRules.description: EU/EEA driving licenses can be converted at any time. Driving licenses from countries with a mutual recognition agreement (Annex 11 of the Driving Licence Regulations) generally do not require an exam. However, there are exceptions, including Albania, Moldova, and some US states. Driving licenses from other countries always require an examination.

drivingRules.title: Validity
drivingRules.description: The foreign driving license remains valid during the six-month transition period. After the conversion, the German EU driving license is valid.

drivingRules.title: Theoretical and practical exam
drivingRules.description: Driving licenses from other countries always require a theory and practical exam. However, no driver training is required. There are no mandatory driving lessons. Furthermore, the decision whether and when to take the exams depends on the applicant's confidence and willingness.

drivingRules.title: Recognition
drivingRules.description: Driving licenses from certain countries (e.g., the USA, Switzerland, Japan) may be fully or partially recognized. Driving licenses from other countries (e.g., Turkey, Russia) require a theory and practical exam. Some authorities require proof of regular driving experience abroad.

drivingRules.title: Old driving license
drivingRules.description: The old driving license must be handed in when the conversion is done (it will be retained or recorded).

drivingCostsData1.title: Basic driving school fee
drivingCostsData1.cost: 500–1.000 € (depending on the region and driving school)

drivingCostsData1.title: Driving lessons
drivingCostsData1.cost: 0–1.200 € (depending on the number of hours required)

drivingCostsData1.title: Total costs
drivingCostsData1.cost: 700–2.000 € (depending on individual learning time and region)

drivingCostsData2.title: Basic driving school fee
drivingCostsData2.cost: 300–800 € (depending on the region and driving school)

drivingCostsData2.title: Driving lessons
drivingCostsData2.cost: 0–2.000 € (depending on the number of hours required)

drivingCostsData2.title: Total costs
drivingCostsData2.cost: 800–3.000 € (depending on individual learning time and region)

licenseForeign.noticeDetails: We only offer our service to the driving classes of A and B, as well as Rewrite (conversion of foreign driving licenses of these classes to German ones). Due to small number of driving schools supporting the driving classes of C, D, L, and T, it is not feasible for us to support these classes at the moment. We hope that we can support these classes as well in the future.

data.heading: 1. Data Controller
data.html:
The entity responsible for data processing on this website is:

Max Mustermann
Musterstraße 123
10115 Berlin

info@wiefuererschein.de

data.heading: 2. General Information on Data Processing
data.html: We process personal data only in accordance with the applicable legal provisions (General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), German Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG), and German Telemedia Act (TMG). This privacy policy informs you about the nature, scope, and purpose of the collection and use of personal data.

data.heading: 3. Collection and Storage of Personal Data
data.html:
a) Registration of Driving Students

When you register as a driving student on our platform, we collect the following data:

  • First and last name
  • Email address
  • Phone number (optional)
  • Place of residence (optional)
  • Username and password

Registration and use of the platform is free of charge for driving students.

b) Registration of Driving Schools

Driving schools using our platform provide the following additional data:

  • Name of the driving school
  • Address of the driving school
  • Phone number of the driving school
  • Email address of the driving school
  • Opening hours
  • Bank details (for processing monthly payments)
  • If applicable, further information about the offer (e.g., types of vehicles, language courses)

c) Booking of Theory and Driving Lessons

When you book appointments, we additionally store:

  • Booked appointments
  • Communication data with driving schools

d) Use of the Contact Form

If you contact us via the contact form or by email, we store your message and the contact details you provide in order to process your request.

data.heading: 4. Payment Processing
data.html:
For driving schools using our platform for a monthly fee, we offer payment processing. For this purpose, we work with the payment service provider [Name of the payment service provider, e.g., Stripe, PayPal]. The following data is processed during payment:

  • Name of the driving school
  • Billing address
  • Bank details
  • Payment history


Data is transmitted encrypted and used solely for payment processing. For further information, please refer to the privacy policy of our payment service provider: [Link to the privacy policy of the payment service provider].

data.heading: 5. Newsletter
data.html: If you subscribe to our newsletter, we collect your email address to regularly send you information about our platform, new features, and offers. Subscription to the newsletter is via a double opt-in procedure. After registration, you will receive an email with a confirmation link. Only after confirmation will you be added to our newsletter distribution list. You can unsubscribe from the newsletter at any time via the unsubscribe link in each email or by sending us a message.

data.heading: 6. Use and Disclosure of Data
data.html:
Your data will be used exclusively for the following purposes:

  • Provision and improvement of our services
  • Communication with you
  • Processing of bookings and payments
  • Answering support requests
  • Sending the newsletter (if subscribed)

Your data will only be disclosed to third parties if this is necessary for the fulfillment of the contract (e.g., to the booked driving school or the payment service provider) or if we are legally obliged to do so.

data.heading: 7. Legal Basis for Data Processing
data.html:
The processing of your data is based on:

  • Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR (consent, e.g., for the newsletter)
  • Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (for the performance of a contract, e.g., for bookings and payments)
  • Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR (legal obligation)
  • Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest, e.g., for improving our services)

data.heading: 8. Storage Period
data.html: Your data will only be stored for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes mentioned. After termination of the user contract or at your request, your data will be deleted, unless legal retention obligations (e.g., tax or commercial law retention periods) prevent this.

data.heading: 9. Your Rights
data.html:
As a user of our platform, you have the following rights:

  • Right of access (Art. 15 GDPR): You can request information about the personal data we process.
  • Right to rectification (Art. 16 GDPR): You can request the correction of inaccurate data.
  • Right to erasure (Art. 17 GDPR): You can request the deletion of your data, provided there are no legal retention obligations.
  • Right to restriction of processing (Art. 18 GDPR): You can request the restriction of the processing of your data.
  • Right to data portability (Art. 20 GDPR): You can receive your data in a machine-readable format.
  • Right to object (Art. 21 GDPR): You can object to the processing of your data.
  • Right to lodge a complaint (Art. 77 GDPR): You can lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

To exercise these rights, please contact: [Email Address]

data.heading: 10. Cookies and Tracking
data.html: Our website uses cookies to make the service more user-friendly. You can disable the storage of cookies in your browser settings. Please note that this may limit the functionality of our website. We do not use third-party tracking tools that collect personal data.

data.heading: 11. Data Security
data.html: We use technical and organizational measures to protect your data from loss, manipulation, and unauthorized access.

data.heading: 12. Changes to this Privacy Policy
data.html: We reserve the right to adapt this privacy policy to changed legal situations or changes in our services. The current version can always be found on this page.

data.heading: Liability for Content
data.html:
As a service provider, we are responsible for our own content on these pages in accordance with general laws pursuant to § 7 Abs.1 TMG. However, according to §§ 8 to 10 TMG, we are not obligated to monitor transmitted or stored third-party information or to investigate circumstances that indicate illegal activity.

Obligations to remove or block the use of information under general laws remain unaffected. However, liability in this regard is only possible from the moment of knowledge of a specific infringement. Upon notification of such violations, we will remove this content immediately.

data.heading: Liability for Links
data.html:
Our website contains links to external third-party websites over whose content we have no control. Therefore, we cannot assume any liability for this external content. The respective provider or operator of the linked pages is always responsible for the content of the linked pages. The linked pages were checked for possible legal violations at the time of linking. Illegal content was not recognizable at the time of linking.

Permanent monitoring of the content of linked pages is not reasonable without concrete evidence of a violation. Upon notification of legal violations, we will remove such links immediately.

data.heading: Copyright
data.html:
The content and works created by the site operators on these pages are subject to German copyright law. Any reproduction, editing, distribution, or other use outside the limits of copyright law requires the written consent of the respective author or creator. Downloads and copies of this site are only permitted for private, non-commercial use.

To the extent that the content on this site was not created by the operator, the copyrights of third parties are respected. In particular, third-party content is identified as such. Should you nevertheless become aware of a copyright infringement, we ask for a corresponding notice. Upon notification of violations, we will remove such content immediately.

This Cookie Policy explains how we use cookies and similar technologies to provide you with an optimal user experience.

As of: 01.10.2025

data.heading: 1. What Are Cookies?
data.html: Cookies are small text files stored by your browser on your device when you visit our website. They allow us to recognize your device on subsequent visits and to store certain information.

data.heading: 2. What Types of Cookies Do We Use?
data.html:
a) Essential Cookies

These cookies are necessary for the operation of our website and enable basic functions such as navigation and access to secure areas. Without these cookies, certain parts of the website may not function properly. These include, for example:

  • Session management (login status, security)
  • Storage of your cookie settings

These cookies cannot be disabled

b) Functional Cookies

These cookies help improve user-friendliness, for example:

  • Saving your language settings
  • Pre-filled forms

c) Analytics Cookies

We use these cookies to understand how our website is used (e.g., with Google Analytics or a similar tool).

  • Collection of anonymized usage data
  • Improvement of our content and features

These cookies are only set with your consent.

d) Marketing Cookies

These cookies enable the display of personalized content or advertising and the integration of external services, such as:
  • Newsletter tracking
  • Payment service providers

Map providers or embedded content

data.heading: 3. Your Consent
data.html: On your first visit to our website, we ask for your consent to use cookies that are not strictly necessary. You can revoke or adjust your consent at any time by accessing the cookie settings.

data.heading: 4. Managing Your Cookie Settings
data.html: You can control or completely disable the use of cookies in your browser settings. Please note that some features of our website may no longer function properly if you disable cookies.

data.heading: 5. Legal Basis
data.html:
The legal basis for the use of cookies is:

  • Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest) for technically necessary cookies
  • Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR (consent) for all other types of cookies

As of: 01.10.2025

data.heading: 1. Scope
data.html: These Terms and Conditions apply to the use of the platform [Name of the Platform] by driving students and driving schools. The platform serves to connect theory and driving lessons and to facilitate communication between driving students and driving schools.

data.heading: 2. Registration and User Accounts
data.html:
a) Driving Students

  • Registration and use of the platform is free of charge for driving students.
  • Users must provide truthful and complete information during registration.
  • Each user is responsible for the confidentiality of their password.


b) Driving Students

  • Driving schools may register after successful verification by the operator.
  • Use of the platform is free of charge for driving schools for the first month. From the second month onwards, use is subject to a fee (see § 3).
  • Driving schools undertake to provide current and accurate information about their driving school (e.g., address, opening hours, contact details).

data.heading: 3. Costs and Payment Terms (for Driving Schools Only)
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • Use of the platform is free of charge for driving schools for the first month. After that, use is subject to a monthly fee.
  • Payment is made via [payment method, e.g., SEPA direct debit, credit card] through our payment service provider [Name of the payment service provider].
  • Payment is debited monthly in advance.
  • Driving schools may terminate the contract with 14 days’ notice to the end of the month.

data.heading: 4. Booking Appointments
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • Driving students can book theory and driving lessons with participating driving schools via the platform.
  • Bookings are binding. Cancellations or changes must be arranged directly with the driving school.
  • The platform accepts no liability for the execution of booked appointments.

data.heading: 5. User Obligations
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • Users undertake to use the platform only for its intended purpose.
  • It is prohibited to provide false information, use the platform for illegal purposes, or harass other users.
  • Driving schools undertake to keep their offers and prices correct and up to date.

data.heading: 6. Liability
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • The operator is not liable for the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of the information provided on the platform.
  • The operator is not liable for damages arising from the use of the platform or the behavior of other users.
  • Driving schools are themselves liable for the execution of booked appointments.

data.heading: 7. Data Protection
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • The collection and processing of personal data is carried out in accordance with our Privacy Policy.
  • Users agree to the Privacy Policy.

data.heading: 8. Termination and Blocking
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • The operator reserves the right to block user accounts in the event of a breach of these Terms and Conditions.
  • Driving schools may terminate their contract with 14 days’ notice.

data.heading: 9. Changes to the Terms and Conditions
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • The operator reserves the right to change these Terms and Conditions.
  • Users will be informed of changes by email.
  • Continued use of the platform after a change constitutes acceptance of the new Terms and Conditions.

data.heading: 10. Final Provisions
data.html:
The following conditions apply:
  • If individual provisions of these Terms and Conditions are or become invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions shall remain unaffected.
  • The law of the Federal Republic of Germany shall apply.
  • The place of jurisdiction is [Location], provided the user is a merchant or does not have a general place of jurisdiction in Germany.

helpPage.pageDes: Finde die Antwort deiner Fragen in unserem Help Center.

AboutUs.Title: What we offer
AboutUs.heroDes: Simplify the process of obtaining a driving license for drivering students and enable more efficient administration for driving schools
AboutUs.contactDes1: We believe that getting a driver's license should be simple, transparent, and stress-free. That's precisely why we created our platform — to help driving students obtain their license and to provide driving schools with an efficient system for managing their students.
AboutUs.contactDes2:
We believe that a driver's license is an important step toward independence and mobility. At the same time, we understand how challenging organization, communication, and scheduling can be for driving students and driving schools. That's why we've created a digital solution that:

• supports driving students free of charge,
• strengthens driving schools with innovative tools and increased visibility,
• and makes the entire process more efficient, clearer and more personal.
AboutUs.contantTitle3: Why we do what we do
AboutUs.contactDes3: The driving school market is often still analog — confusing, paper-heavy, and not always transparent. We want to change that and create real added value for both parties with our platform: modern tools for driving schools and a clear, simple experience for students

items.title: Find and compare driving schools
items.description: Discover driving schools near you and find the right one for you

items.title: Personal progress tracker
items.description: Keep track of your completed theory and driving hours, exam dates and your learning progress

items.title: Book appointments online
items.description: Book theory and practical lessons conveniently via the website – without phone calls or waiting times

items.title: Direct communication
items.description: Chat safely and easily with your driving school, ask questions and clarify everything important

items.title: Tips on necessary documents
items.description: Use our tips to prepare the necessary documents for your driver's license application

items.title: Attracting new driving students
items.description: Present your offer on our platform and reach targeted driving students in your region

items.title: Appointment management
items.description: Manage bookings digitally, reduce no-shows and save time

items.title: Centralize communication
items.description: Answer inquiries and organize exchanges with students via our secure chat function

items.title: Progress documentation
items.description: Record your students’ learning progress and provide them with a transparent overview

items.title: Monthly subscription model
items.description: Enjoy all the benefits of our platform for a fixed, predictable monthly fee – no hidden costs

contactPage.pageDes: If you haven't found the answer to your question in our Help Center, or if you simply have questions, feel free to send us an email.
